page.title: 02ECOLOGY IN TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: Flora: 42 species of flowers and plants identified. 16 species of trees, hedges and shrubs identified. 12 species of grasses identified. Fauna: 4 species of butterflies identified. 10 species of birds identified. Rabbits, foxes and badgers spotted. Also a heron and kingfisher had been seen around the stream in the area. It is 600ft above sea-level and climate is exposed and windy on hilltops. Soil is medium loam. Undulating hills are mostly covered by fields and wooded areas. One stream through area with fish. No pollution. Many footpaths mainly around edges of fields but they are rarely used and in consequence are overgrown and often have been ploughed up or blocked by fencing
